com.github.mrgoro.interactivedata.api.data.bean

Interface DataObject

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MapDataObject, ReflectiveDataObject

    public interface DataObject
    Data Access Object for easy accessing data in objects with keys and values.

    The easiest form of a DataObject is a wrapper around a Map<String, Object>.

    Author:
    Philipp Schürmann

    • Method Summary

      • getOptionalProperty

        default java.util.Optional<java.lang.Object> getOptionalProperty(java.lang.String name)
        Get a property by its name.

        Optional is empty when property is non existent.

        Parameters:
        name - Name of the property
        Returns:
        Optional containing the value of the property, or empty when property is non existent

      • getProperty

        default <T> T getProperty(java.lang.String name,
                          java.lang.Class<T> type)
                   throws java.lang.NoSuchFieldException
        Get a property by its name with the correct type.

        The Method explicitly casts the property's value to the specified type. Throws ClassCastException when casting fails.

        Type Parameters:
        T - Type of the property
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the property
        type - Type of the property
        Returns:
        Value of the property
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchFieldException - When property is non existent
        java.lang.ClassCastException - if the object is not null and is not assignable to the type T

      • getOptionalProperty

        default <T> java.util.Optional<T> getOptionalProperty(java.lang.String name,
                                                      java.lang.Class<T> type)
        Get a property by its name with the correct type.

        Optional is empty when property is non existent.

        The Method explicitly casts the property's value to the specified type. Throws ClassCastException when casting fails.

        Type Parameters:
        T - Type of the property
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the property
        type - Type of the property
        Returns:
        Optional containing the value of the property, or empty when property is non existent
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassCastException - if the object is not null and is not assignable to the type T
